PipelineUtilities.py - helper functions for CGAT pipelines¶

Author:Steve Sansom
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

To make excuting database commands and files IO as trivial and (TODO: robust) as possible possible. Before changing the default behaviour of any of these functions please discuss!. Better to add new functions and then deprecate.

Usage¶

Type:

python <script_name>.py --help

for command line help.

Code¶

PipelineUtilities.db_execute(cc, statements)¶

excute a statement or statements against a cursor

PipelineUtilities.execute(queries, database='csvdb', attach=False)¶

Execute a statement or a list of statements (sequentially)

PipelineUtilities.fetch(query, database='csvdb', attach=False)¶

Fetch all query results and return

PipelineUtilities.fetch_with_names(query, database='csvdb', attach=False)¶

Fetch query results and returns them as an array of row arrays, in which the first entry is an array of the field names

PipelineUtilities.fetch_DataFrame(query, database='csvdb', attach=False)¶

Fetch query results and returns them as a pandas dataframe

PipelineUtilities.write(outfile, lines, header=False)¶

expects [[[line1-field1],[line1-field2 ] ],... ]

PipelineUtilities.biomart_iterator(attributes, host, biomart, dataset, filters=None, values=None)¶

Modified from pipeline biomart...

PipelineUtilities.txtToDict(filename, key=None, sep='\t')¶

make a dictionary from a text file keyed on the specified column

PipelineUtilities.save(file_name, obj)¶

dump a python object to a file using pickle

PipelineUtilities.load(file_name)¶

retrieve a pickled python object from a file
